entry.title: [CodeHealth] std::unique_ptr<T[]> -> HeapArray in color_correction_test_utils.cc
entry.content:
This CL replaces the use of std::unique_ptr with the use of

HeapArray in color_correction_test_utils.cc



Using std::unique_ptr does not automatically preserve the

size of the allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc bounds

checks, leading to bugs which attackers use to compromise our users.



This CL is a part of a code health rotation effort to eliminate

the usage of std::unique_ptr.



More details in the one-pager:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1YsPR8GoN8VTP1ABKCISaQkuBif1Cn80cTxTjsM8QT4s/edit?resourcekey=0-3qKCKgDwFwwjS7KI5XAcBQ&tab=t.0



Bug: 326458659, 326459373, 326458840, 326459217, 40285824

Change-Id: Id3cedd37d430bc55edd5eca19ca7e6f13249b227

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5335539

entry.title: CrOS Settings: Move ReadWriteCardsManagerImpl initialization
entry.content:
Move the initialization of ReadWriteCardsManager from PostProfileInit to

PreProfileInit to address the dependency issue for the OsSettingsManager

which is created right after user logs and user profile is ready.



SearchSection which is owned by the OsSettingsManager always assumes

that the QuickAnswerController owned by the ReadWriteCardsManager is

always created before itself. Thus moving the initialization of

ReadWriteCardsManager to the PreProfileInit to ensure.



Bug: b/327496668

entry.title: [text-box-trim] Handle when the last child is empty
entry.content:
This patch handles when `text-box-trim: end` but the last

child was empty, by retrying the layout.



Note that this patch handles only whether to trim or not. The

actual amount to trim should be implemented in

`InlineLayoutAlgorithm` in future patches. More code changes

will be needed when `InlineLayoutAlgorithm` makes progress.



See also the design doc[1].



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1eT0xEOrfVI3RhZ6goJLW1yOWHXLBq2tzAYrHe3NIiO8/edit#bookmark=id.pkbu9w2ipp14

entry.title: Reset PlusAddressHttpClient on sign out.
entry.content:
Prior to this CL, the following edge case could occur:

- The user would send a request to the plus address server.

- The user would sign out (and/or sign in with a different account).

- The request would complete and be processed by the new user.



This CL resets all network requests on sign out. A follow-up CL will

add a mechanism to make sure that callbacks from the thus cancelled

requests are still run with a "kSignoutError".



Bug: 323731009

Change-Id: I5ab0e5d900a29a902e8822b5ccabfeb1d14b6e79

entry.title: media/gpu/V4L2StatefulVD: handle broken NALU type
entry.content:
Reports from the field show that the CHECK for known NALU type

is being hit, which means it's a(n unsigned) value beyond the

known ones. Originally the code assumed that H264Parser would

not allow this to happen but closer inspection of that class

shows that there is no particular check on the bitstream

data [1], so it could have any 5-bit number.



This CL simply changes the code to not crash but return error

if a broken NALU type is returned.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/video/h264_parser.cc;l=536;drc=644874afbd6aa7c5de82636ad52d6b298c34a458?q=AdvanceToNextNALU



Bug: b:324478176

Change-Id: I34425e6c777f9ec42d62f95a75faaf25f4f1d395

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5369572

entry.title: Reland "Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 49599d86419c742d12d118e12bf30b79f64c69b0



Original change's description:

> Move code from base::ByteSwap to base::numerics and fix UB casts

>

> While moving ByteSwap() callers, I found the DTS code doing byte swaps

> by casting byte spans to uint16_t spans, which causes UB if they are

> not aligned. The function explicitly handles non-16-bit aligned inputs

> earlier, so clearly it's expected and we should not CHECK on the

> alignment. So instead, change the code to work with bytes and do the

> swaps in a for loop.

>

> While here, make use of the new split_at() to split the output span

> up into disjoint subspans that are each written to.

>

> R=dalecurtis@chromium.org

>

> Bug: 40284755

> Change-Id: I11c557fd3e0f6fd64555b299f3492ca7722aeae2

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366084

> Reviewed-by: Dale Curtis

> Owners-Override: danakj

> Commit-Queue: danakj

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271821}

entry.title: Migrating code from base::ByteSwap and friends to byte conversions
entry.content:
ByteSwap + memcpy (or similar via iterators) can be spelt more clearly

with the new base::numerics byte conversions to convert to and from

byte arrays of big/little endian.



Some code uses BigEndianReader + ByteSwap to read little endian

buffers! Introduce SpanReader to provide a simple api around reading

off the front of the span dynamically in place of using many nested

split_at() calls.



SpanReader overlaps with BufferIterator in some ways, but it provides

a more ergonomic API for reading off spans (including fixed size

spans) and dealing with running out of room explicitly, like

BigEndianReader did. And it does not introduce the complexity of

worrying about seeking or truncating to users of the API.



Bug: 40284755

entry.title: [MappableSI] Make ExoTestHelper methods static.
entry.content:
1. Make ExoTestHelper::CreateBuffer and

ExoTestHelper::CreateGpuMemoryBuffer static as it does not use any

class members. Update all relevant uses.



2. Remove ExoTestHelper::CreateGpuMemoryBuffer usage as its no longer

needed after converting tests to use ::CreateBuffer instead.



3. Add a new method ExoTestHelper::CreateBufferFromGMBHandle() to allow

tests to continue using GMBs for Map()/Unmap() for now. Later these

tests will be converted to use mappableSI directly.



4. Update Buffer::CreateBuffer to take is_overlay_candidate as an

additional params which some tests requires.



5. Update ExoTestHelper::CreateBuffer to take is_overlay_candidate as an

additional param required by some tests.



6. Convert tests to use ExoTestHelper::CreateBuffer instead of using

::CreateGpuMemoryBuffer.

entry.title: Use UserConsentVerifier API for OS authentication on Windows
entry.content:
Changes this CL makes are hidden behind a feature flag.

This CL makes the OS authentication use the new UserConsentVerifier

API. This API works only if user has windows hello configured,

because of that if call to it fails the legacy API will be used.



That change is needed since this new API doesn't block UI thread and

Chrome can still perform its tasks while authentication prompt is

visible. Because of that it aims to reduce lag that happened for some

users after completing authentication using the previous API.

entry.title: p13n: Fix sequential tab navigation for recent wallpaper items and menu
entry.content:
Previously when sequentially tabbing through recent seapen wallpapers,

once the menu button was focused, the focus gets stuck on subsequent

menu buttons. This fixes that issue by applying the same tabindex of

the wallpaper item to the menu button. That is- a menu button should

only be focusable via sequential tab navigation if its respective

wallpaper item is also tab focusable. Sequential wallpaper items are

still focusable using the arrow keys.

forever for that promise, simply "failing" the auction upon destruction

of the TestCase [0].



Also move fields to match the order in the mojom file.



Longer-term, we'll need a way to monitor when we've lost coverage like

this.

entry.title: [test] Reland: Suppress generation of stack traces in death tests
entry.content:
In https://crrev.com/1246434, we suppressed symbolized stack traces in

death test child procs. While this worked for CHECK and DCHECK messages,

it did not catch other code, such as ObserverList, that may do its own

symbolization. In this change, we switch to suppressing symbolization in

death test child procs in base::StackTrace itself. This avoids the need

to chase down all callers and catch new callers.



Death tests that assert the contents of stack traces can selectively

override this suppression via OverrideSuppressedOutputForTesting.

Reason for revert: Unregistering before the broadcast receiver is registered, due to delayed registration running in BG thread, causes an exception. We should revert, and in the re-land, add a sequenced task runner to make sure the registration occurred before unregistering the broadcast receiver.

entry.title: Remove fields that will be skipped by the renderer for filling
entry.content:
When filling forms, we detect fields to skip in the browser, but we

still send them to the renderer and have the renderer skip them again.



This CL removes them from the list of fields to be sent to the renderer

to reduce the logic in the renderer.



This CL also adds logic to skip and hence remove fields sent to the

renderer for which no value could be found for filling, or for fields

which were autofilled with the same value as before.



This results in fewer data sent from the browser to the renderer via

mojo.

entry.title: Mark the-img-element/srcset/avoid-reload-on-resize.html as flaky
entry.content:
external/wpt/html/semantics/embedded-content/the-img-element/srcset/avoid-reload-on-resize.html

occasionally fails due to the preloaded image not being reused due to

caching policy, which depends on if image preloading completes before

requesting the image during parsing. This test fails more often with

BoostResourceLoadingTaskPriorities enabled, which causes the image

loading task on the main thread to run sooner, increasing the

probability that the preloaded image won't be used.



This CL marks the test as flaky so we can reland the field trial

config for BoostResourceLoadingTaskPriorities.

entry.title: Revert "Make Chrome robust against XMM register corruption"
entry.content:
This reverts commit fd45b27a281e666ee936f05b1f3eec24c7518a95.



Reason for revert: This hacky workaround landed over 15 months ago.

The buggy software that was triggering the crashes was patched, and

users have had time to deploy the fix. Therefore it is time to

remove the hack.



Original change's description:

> Make Chrome robust against XMM register corruption

>

> XMM7 is supposed to be preserved by functions according to the Windows

> ABI, but some third-party products fail to honor that, leading to

> crashes in Chrome. A fix to a known-buggy third-party product has been

> released but may take a while to propagate. This change tells the

> compiler not to assume that the non-volatile XMM registers are preserved

> after calls to run tasks. This forces the compiler to preserve the

> potentially corrupted registers, which should stop the crashes.

>

> This fix was found to be both necessary and sufficient by looking at the

> disassembly in official builds and confirming that after this change XMM

> registers are cleared shortly before use, and preserved/restored at

> function start/stop. Previous attempts that disabled inlining of

> problematic functions fixed specific instances but were not sufficient

> to fix all problems and were not robust against future code changes.

>

> See crrev.com/c/4087156 as an example of a not-quite-complete fix.

>

> Bug: 1218384

> Change-Id: Iff64204559594036c91a90abdf1d4a00501e2d00

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4087650

> Auto-Submit: Bruce Dawson

> Commit-Queue: Bruce Dawson

> Reviewed-by: Gabriel Charette

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1081511}



Bug: 1218384

Change-Id: Ic74e644117e31c375bb8b4f7d2c070cfad9acd73

entry.title: [sync] Fix bookmark's initial Sync violating storage boundaries
entry.content:
...specifically for the case where UUID-based lookups may accidentally

surface deduplication matches, causing the unintended move of local

bookmarks to account storage. This scenario can be easily hit if the

user turns sync on, then off and later signs in with account bookmarks,

as done in the newly-added integration test.



The actual underlying issue, being solved here, is that

BookmarkModelView::root_node() always needs to be used in combination

with BookmarkModelView::IsNodeSyncable(). This codepath was presumably

overlooked in https://crrev.com/c/4964681 because managed nodes cannot

actually run into UUID collisions, as the UUIDs are always random and

managed nodes don't actually get sync-ed.

entry.title: Add system-ui as font to substitute when font from PlatformData is null
entry.content:
For some web fonts for which we use FreeType backend (for instance some

colour fonts), `CtFont` from `FontPlatformData` is null. For these fonts

FontCache::PlatformFallbackFontForCharacter should be still able to find

a substitute font.

Use default standard font from user settings as the font to substitute

from in `CTFontCreateUIFontForLanguage` when CT font from `PlatformData`

is null.

entry.title: [ios] Update price tracking to deal with unified Bookmark Model
entry.content:
Behavioral changes only behind disabled feature flag.



The code changes surfaced a suspicious existing codepath that is now

annotated with a TODO but not tackled yet. Namely, it is unclear why

previously LocalOrSyncableBookmarkModelFactory was used instead of, or

in addition to, AccountBookmarkModelFactory.



When `syncer::kEnableBookmarkFoldersForAccountStorage` is enabled, there

is only one BookmarkModel instance per BrowserState and hence price

notifications and related features should use this instance.



`PriceNotificationsPriceTrackingMediator` is simplified to remove dead

code as `syncer::kReplaceSyncPromosWithSignInPromos` is enabled by

default on iOS and subject to code cleanup.



Design doc (sorry, Googlers only):

https://docs.google.com/document/d/11Dm4-FWEpT_fgxfAeq16O8qxOtaOZbU2o3MZeHDByUM/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: Kcer: Record PKCS#12 dual-write events
entry.content:
As a part of a migration, PKCS#12 certificates can be dual-written

using Kcer and NSS. Store dual-write events into preferences, so a

rollback can be executed when necessary, if the migration doesn’t

go as planned.



The certificates can be imported from both Ash and Lacros, but the

rollback will always be executed by Ash, so the preference always

needs to be in Ash. Add a method to the CertDatabase mojo interface

to notify Ash when Lacros dual-writes a cert.



Bug: b/264387231

Test: *Kcer*, *CertificateManager* automated tests

entry.title: Add a use counter for “cursor: hand”.
entry.content:
A ton of web pages use “cursor: hand”, which is a quirks mode hack

for IE5.5 compatibility (it was unneeded from IE6, and removed in IE9),

but nearly all of them have various workarounds so that it doesn't

matter if we remove the functionality. Add a use counter that tries to

capture how often it actually matters.



This is intended to be temporary (perhaps live for one stable release

or similar), so that we get enough data to hopefully remove the

functionality, and then remove the counter again.

entry.title: [ios] Fix crash in SessionRestorationServiceImpl
entry.content:
The code for handling detached WebState would crash if a realized

WebState was inserted in a Browser and detached before the Browser

could be saved because no metadata was present in the metadata_map.



Add a check when handling detached WebState to skip items without

metadata. This is okay since OrphanInfo is only used when adopting

an unrealized WebState, and unrealized WebState metadata is always

present in the map (it is either inserted when loaded from disk,

when adopted from another Browser or when created by the helper

`CreateUnrealizedWebState`).



Fixed: 329219388

entry.title: Reland "Skip static animations on compositor and main"
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit 3690cd7872423e81e74dc66f9886e355a7c1b659



The two tests that regressed have been dealt with. One already

had equivalent test functionality in WPT and could simply be deleted

with no loss of test coverage. The other was ported from a non-WPT

testRunner based pixel test to a WPT ref-test.



Original change's description:

> Skip static animations on compositor and main

>

> An animation with empty keyframes or with keyframes whose property

> values are identical between frames previously ran as a normal

> animation. As there is no visual change other than at a phase boundary,

> these animations do not need to run on the compositor, and only need

> to be scheduled on the main thread at phase boundaries.

>

> This is the first step in optimizing no-op animations. A follow up

> patch will short-circuit sampling when the property value is constant.

> Another patch will refine the rules for background color compositing

> to only consider dynamic properties. Finally, metrics will be added

> to track shorthand expansion of CSS properties, which is likely the

> most common source of static properties in CSS animations.

>

> Bug: 40728212

> Change-Id: I1baff2d0d26400f91f12d4cac2141e9bb101b3d0

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5328026

> Reviewed-by: Ian Clelland

> Reviewed-by: Robert Flack

> Commit-Queue: Kevin Ellis

entry.title: Only overlay video without SurfaceControl
entry.content:
With low latency canvas, not all overlay candidates are video anymore.

But without SurfaceControl (ie using OverlayProcessorAndroid),

overlay should only be attempted on SurfaceView-like video, where viz

just does hole punching and does not directly control the video

buffers. In particular it should not attempt to overlay low latency

canvas which will fail.



Modify the bool condition a bit to account specifically for video and

SurfaceView, which no longer assumes all candidates are video.



Bug: 40288143

entry.title: Update CookiePartitionKey (de)serialization to use a class instead of a string
entry.content:
Currently the CookiePartitionKey (de)serialization methods consume or return a string that contains the top_level_site. The future incorporation of the ancestor chain bit means that the bit would have to be serialized into that string. Which has the potential to cause errors and might be unclear to developers when the serialized string is utilized in other parts of the system. Using a defined class will prevent these issues and allow for future extension if required.



Bug: 326610082

entry.title: [ios] Use 2 different slots to send form mutations, one for each type
entry.content:
Each type of form mutation has a slot for being sent to the browser

in the next scheduled batch of messages. Once the slot is filled for

a type, the batch won't accept any new mutations for that type.



2 types are currently supported: added form and removed form.



This will allow notifying enough information when replacing forms

while keeping the throttling tight by only allowing one batch at

a time.



Bug: 325415935

entry.title: [Blink] Have WebGPUSwapBufferProvider use CSI to get texture target
entry.content:
This CL converts WebGPUSwapBufferProvider away from overriding the

texture target to use on MacOS only to call

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTargetForOverlays(), which has identical

semantics to the current flow:



* Returns GetPlatformSpecificTextureTarget() on Mac

* Return GL_TEXTURE_2D otherwise



This is a step on the road to the eventual goal of having all client

texture target computation behind a universal

ClientSharedImage::GetTextureTarget() function. When we get to that

place, the current slight weirdness of calling a function named

"...ForOverlays()" regardless of whether the SharedImage is an overlay

candidate will go away (it was challenging to come up with the best

name for that stand-in function given its use cases :P).



Bug: 41494843

entry.title: [iOS] Fix account picker identity button hiding animation
entry.content:
This CL fixes the animation that occurs when the identity button in the

account picker is hidden/shown. This animation would sometimes break the

state of the stack view which contains this identity button. It appears

that adding a completion block to the animation where we definitively

hide/show the identity button fixes this issue.



This fix can be tested manually by quickly switching between the two

options Files and Drive in the account picker view presented by Save to

Drive. Before the fix, the animation would eventually get stuck and

switching between Files and Drive would not animate anything anymore.

After the fix, the animation should never get stuck.



Fixed: 329387878

entry.title: [Sync] Support collaborations in gc_directive
entry.content:
This CL implements garbage collection for collaborations. The server is

expected to provide a list of active collaborations for every

GetUpdates. If some collaboration is not present in the list, all the

previous entities and upcoming updates will be removed / stopped

tracking.



This CL also adds support for collaborations to the fake server but

there are no currently use cases for them. They will be added in

follow-up CLs.

entry.title: Extend net::RequestPriority for browser-initiated prefetch
entry.content:
This CL extends the logic of determining net::RequestPriority to

introduce the default value of it for browser-initiated triggers.

As of now, this CL adopts RequestPriority::IDLE to it, which is the same

value of eager prefetches.



Current behaviors are verified in some tests in

prefetch_service_unittest using VerifyCommonRequestState,

ExpectedPriorityForEagerness.

The test case of browser-initiated ones will be addressed in a follow-up

CL, once after introducing the basic concepts of browser-initiated

triggers.



For more context, please see https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Cr4MyJAA42c1m7MrEHgH_IIlKHA6EfiBdRGpP_RiDKQ/edit?resourcekey=0-ySgOZBi6gdfSRwe3ZYWOLA&tab=t.0#heading=h.gjs6l1h2rr2c

entry.title: Reland "Reland "[ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script""
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e628fca793dea9493483753d202c5ca54a52cb9d



With https://gn-review.googlesource.com/16860, the ninja build action

that invokes the swiftc.py script has `restat = 1`. This causes ninja

to support the optimisation that output are not changed if not needed

(e.g. if input was just reformated, the compilation was not required).



This ensures that "no-op" builds are not considered dirty, and allow

to re-enable the FileWriter optimisation (to allow swiftc to see that

the compilation is not needed either, when possible).



Checked locally that this fixes the "no-op" build considered dirty

failure that was reproducible at 100% rate with previous version of

gn (without `restat = 1`).



Original change's description:

> Reland "[ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script"

>

> This is a reland of commit 555b7f43f59a6291b935c1dd8e99fc6ce77d183e

>

> Fixes the following issues that lead to reverting the original CL:

>

> 1. The compilation was sometimes considered dirty after an incremental

> build due to optimizations in both the script (FileWriter) and in

> swiftc itself where output file are not overwritten if identical.

>

> This was fixed by removing the use of FileWriter from the script and

> by touching all the outputs of the compilation (thus the file should

> now have newer timestamp than the source).

>

> 2. The compilation for catalyst environment was broken because swiftc

> expects different command-line argument for that environment (i.e.

> -isystem is unsupported, -Xcc ... is also unsupported).

>

> The script is modified to check whether the target triple

> corresponds to the catalyst environment (i.e. matches *-macabi)

> and constructs an acceptable command-line.

>

> 3. As `gn check ...` did not know about the Objective-C generated

> header for Swift modules, some dependencies were missing which

> also caused dirty build after an incremental build. This was

> fixed by https://crrev.com/c/5348787.

>

> Original change's description:

> > [ios] Improve build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py script

> >

> > Change the script build/toolchain/ios/swiftc.py to configure the

> > swift compiler to generate $input.swiftconstvalues files (needed

> > for Intents API in swift).

> >

> > Improve the code to put all the derived data in one directory,

> > which allow removing the need for -pch-output-dir $dir from the

> > invocation of the script and its list of outputs (should avoid

> > the compilation error where $dir is created as a file instead of

> > a directory).

> >

> > Change toolchain.gni to pass all the tool versions as environment

> > variables instead of command-line arguments (reduce the length of

> > the command-line and remove the need to parse those arguments in

> > the script).

> >

> > Allow keeping the derived data dir between invocations of the

> > script (which may improve the build performance as the swiftc

> > binary will not have to rebuild the module cache each time).

> >

> > Bug: 326059372

> > Change-Id: I5e42676eb917fe2d355383aaa39a60d5674816fb

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319176

> > Commit-Queue: Sylvain Defresne

> > Reviewed-by: Federica Germinario

> > Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1268444}

>

> Bug: 326059372

> Cq-Include-Trybots: luci.chromium.try:ios-catalyst

> Change-Id: I94b9783441b2f92dc3e6caf8bb6a3522bc0cb419

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5349118

> Reviewed-by: Federica Germinario

entry.title: Do not try to evict invalid surface ID
entry.content:
There is a timing where CollectSurfaceIdsForEviction can be called when

surfaces have already been evicted. In this case, the evicted surface

IDs will have been marked as invalid. Existing code for the embedded

client checks if the surface IDs are valid before returning them for

eviction, but for native occlusion the ui compositor window's surface

ID is not checked.



This CL adds the same check for the ui compositor window's surface ID.



Bug: 328935971

Test: local testing + CQ
